p: Analyses of case records date the first documented rabies case in Yunnan Province back to 1956. These data indicate that an epidemic wave of rabies occurred in the 1980s and that, from the mid-1990s onwards, human rabies cases were reported only sporadically in the region. However, starting in 1999, a new RABV epidemic emerged. More than 900 human rabies cases were reported during 1999â€“2015, with the highest incidence of 0.3 cases per 100,000 people occurring in 2010 ( Fig 1A). Human rabies in Yunnan was first reported in 1999 in the Southeast prefecture of Wenshan, which borders Vietnam and the Chinese province of Guangxi and spread across the province in the next decade [ 25].
